page.title: 05RESIDENTS' OPINIONS
page.content: The residents are equally divided between those whose families have lived in the area for generations and those who have chosen to move to this area because of its beauty even though their place of employment may be as far away as London.This division is reflected in their attitudes,the former expressing great concern over the lack of public transport,large shops and places of entertainment,the latter having a strong desire to retain the unspoilt nature of the area. The concern which unites all residents is that of low flying aircraft,this being a designated area for low flying practice by the Royal Air Force.Within the valley planes fly lower than some houses,vibrate buildings and cause distress to humans and livestock.
